description: a(n)^2 is the smallest square whose digits occur with the same frequency n.
links: P. De Geest, Numbers whose digits occur with same frequency
example: E.g. 31646191^2 = 1001481404808481 and its digits 0, 1, 4 and 8 each occur four times.
author: _Patrick De Geest_, Jan 15 2000.
extensions: 2 more terms from _Jon E. Schoenfield_, Aug 18 2007
